message: We all know how wonderful Python is but do enough non-Python people know it as well? The PSF is working on a brochure designed to explain Python to non-technical people in all walks of life why they also should think Python is wonderful. From future Nobel laureates to top managers to school teachers and politicians: Python has something to offer for everyone. So no code samples but lots of real world use cases about how Python has helped changed lives.

We would love to hear from anyone who has a good Python story to tell. If you have a story or want more information about the brochure - we're also looking for sponsors - then you can talk to Steve Holden, Tim Couper, Jeff Rush or Charlie Clark at PyCon. http://brochure.getpython.info
I have some printed flyers with me if anyone wants to take one home to persuade their bosses ti support this project
